reviews.text: The rooms are fairly comfortable if a bit small - not much space to move around the bed. The modern decor is nicely co-ordinated in plaid and stripes. The best feature in the room is the king bed, w/ a soft duvet, fluffy down pillows and decent mattress. There is also a wing chair w/ ottoman, as well as a nice window seat in the bay window.

reviews.title: Loved the Crest
reviews.text: The lighting is poor, however, so if you plan on working in your room, you will find it too dark. The lamps are in bad spots so the entire room is left dim.

reviews.title: Great place to stay!
reviews.text: The small bathroom has some modern features. The best thing is the heat lamp to keep you warm as soon as you can step out of the tub. Illumination is excellent but there is no counter space to lay out your toiletries. The bathtub was old and not altogether clean between the white ceramic tiles. Wouldn't have minded that if I could have had a hot shower. I would lose the hot water when someone else in the hotel flushed the toilet or whatever. Quite frustrating to stand and wait for the hot water to come back on and then sometimes, too hot.

I'm writing this review from my desk in room 201 at the Crest Hotel in Prince Rupert. To my left is an inviting reading chair, a gas fireplace with a flat screen tv atop. To my right is a panoramic view of the Prince Rupert Harbour, a freighter carefully maneuvering about and a bald eagle perched in a tree so close I don't need the complimentary binoculars sitting on the bench seat below the window. I've known about the Crest for years but this is my first time staying and it hasn't disappointed. Quality furnishings and amenities are always on my check list when rating a room and the Aveda products, walk in glass enclosed shower and huge soaker tub all deliver. The king size bed was very comfortable and I could have slept longer but chose to leave my window open to enjoy the early morning view. If you can, upgrade to one of these amazing view rooms. I'm sure the rest of the regular units are nice but the real experience - the room matching the Super, Natural view, is worth the extra.
reviews.title: Eagles, ocean and a little bit of luxury

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Crest regularly since about 2006, and do not hesitate to recommend it. The rooms and bathrooms are large, the towels are great, there are sufficient (large) pillows and the beds are extremely comfortable. The staff are pleasant and welcoming, and have great memories. My most recent stay was last week, and I really appreciate the welcome, the Aveda bath products, and the comfort & convenience of the hotel.
reviews.title: Travelling solo for business

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying at the Crest in February, and found the facilities on par with any other five star hotel in larger metropolitan areas. The meeting room provided just off the main lobby was the perfect size for our purposes, and the service staff were very unobtrusive in setting up coffee and lunch.
reviews.title: Excellent value for your business dollar

reviews.text: Highly recommended for business meetings, and by the same token it would be just as recommended for vacation.
reviews.title: Best in Prince Rupert for business

reviews.text: Moved over to the Crest after a few disappointing stays at other facilities. The Crest is not cheap but they deliver excellent quality rooms and friendly helpful service. We were there working and they accomodated our needs nicely. Dont miss the dining as its pretty fine.
reviews.title: Best stay in town

reviews.text: My wife and I decided to try out the infamous Crest in Prince Rupert, a decision we now regret. We checked in but our room was not ready and were told it would be 1/2 an hour so we wandered next door to the casino. We came back in about 40 minutes then sat in the lobby for another 20 minutes before finaly asking the girl at the counter if it was ready... "oh yeah I forgot"... "yes it is ready"

4 Stars @ a 3 Star Price
reviews.text: The room was ok... nothing special, the remote barely worked and had 2 be 6" from the TV to make anything happen. There is no water pressure for showering so instead we bathed in the YELLOW water.

In the morning we woke up to the delight of finding a USED feminin hygene product in the bed we had just slept in. Upon complaint to the front desk we were offered $20 off of our stay. A fair price for possibly conracting a deadly disease or hepititis etc.
reviews.title: Old fashioned hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for 5 days. Before arriving I called ahead to secure a fridge for my room. The hotel employee had trouble figuring out how to secure this to one of the rooms, as my booking was done in a group. When I arrived at the hotel to check in I inquired about the fridge. I was told that it would be in there if they had any available. When I got to my room, I did not have one. I later learned that one of my coworkers had a fridge in his room!! Argh!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is nice the rooms are nice enough as well. The bathrooms are a little tight, so make sure you have travel size bottles of everything, or you will have trouble finding a surface for your stuff.
reviews.title: Great Place and Dog Friendly

reviews.text: The 2 restaurants in the hotel are very nice (they share a menu and kitchen). The food is good, but a little expensive, and the service is slow no matter what time of day. I think they are aiming to be the high end dining location in Prince Rupert.
reviews.title: Great stay in Prince Rupert

reviews.text: The exercise room, is adequate (but on the dingy side). The steam room is right in the weight room, so you will find it pretty humid and dank in there until you open a window to let out some of the condensation.
reviews.title: Best Place in Prince Rupert to stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Crest Hotel in Prince Rupert while travelling with our 6 yr old and our dog Gunner. The hotel is probably one of the best places to stay in town. Our room overlooked the water, and had a lovely bay window with a seat and binnoculars, which delighted our little one for hours. The room had two queen beds and a spacious bathroom with rain shower. It was also very quiet. The staff were very friendly and the dinning room was excellent. While the prices were a bit more than we usually pay, it was all worth it! If you can't afford to stay here then you should at least have breakfast here! Sitting in the dinning room with giant glass windows while watching the sun come up over the water will really take your breath away!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay; will be back
